channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 30cm pothole (10+ cm deep) on Kidnappers Lane, 19th January
item.description:
Pothole on left hand side of road, just before gate into Lotts Meadow, when travelling towards Church Road. Pothole has got significant larger and deeper in recent rains causing damage to vehicles and safety risk to cyclists give the narrowness of Kidnappers Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Field Cottage Kidnappers Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed and mattress dumped, 19th January
item.description:
A bed and mattress have been dumped by some lazy cockwomble.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Fiddington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely deteriorated pavement along Limber Hill, 19th January
item.description:
The pavement either side of Limber Hill road near Prestbury is damaged and fragmented - the asphalt is cracking and crumbling substantially, making it very dangerous to walk along. It also paces uphill, making it challenging and uncomfortable for residents to use especially if they are elderly or infirm. It also gets very icy and slippery in winter as it's in very poor condition overall, and not safe to use. Please could you take a look into it? Many thanks, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Limber Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 15 meter long pothole along Roman Hackle Avenue, 19th January
item.description:
There's quite a dangerous and lengthy pothole running along the centre of Roman Hackle Avenue near Prestbury - it's quite deep at one end but has caused concern to local residents. Please could you take a look? Thanks, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Limber Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerb clearance, 19th January
item.description:
The kerbs the whole length of Montpellier Spa Road are completely blocked with accumulated mud , sludge and leaves and badly need clearing , combination of manpower and sweeper required . Sir rob Wright Chairman Friends of Montpellier Gardens and residents association

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34a Montpellier Spa Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsiding manholes, 19th January
item.description:
Hi, As per title, this manhole has subsided and is awful to drive over. Please assess and mend? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 158 London Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Excessive Litter, 19th January
item.description:
There is a lot of litter by this underpass, it has blown in from the A417 and the lay by on the opposite side of the road. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Elkstone

item.title: New light - doesn't work, 19th January
item.description:
New street light installed on pavement at junction of Queens Road and Gloucester Road (roundabout) - installed several weeks ago (mid-December), but to date does not work. On wide pavement, adjacent to stone boundary wall to railway station, by station sign. Been there several weeks now, so about time it actually worked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pothole oposite No3 Finchcroft Lane Prerstbury, 18th January
item.description:
Large deep pothole oposite No3 Finchcroft Lane Prerstbury hard to avoid and fill with t=water
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Finchcroft Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path slippery & muddy, 18th January
item.description:
The pathway in Cox’s Meadow has got very muddy and dangerously slippy and the many people who are now walking along there are bunching up because they’re trying to avoid it. Even the cyclists aren’t cycling in it because it is just so muddy. This is dangerous both in a Covid perspective and from a collision perspective if the bikes are cycling along the pedestrian side. Something urgently needs to be done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road, 17th January
item.description:
At root of Charlton Abbots hill beside gateway into field, there is a hole in the left hand side of the road heading toward Charlton Abbots. Hole has been increasing in size for 2 years and is large enough to damage a cycle wheel.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep dangerous pothole outside 8 Coberley Road, 16th January
item.description:
Pothole has existed since November 2020. Now it’s very deep and wide with hardcore spread over the road. Hardcore is being thrown up by passing cars and it hitting parked vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Coberley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dozens on bins permanently on pavement, 15th January
item.description:
Dozens of waste / recycling bins, permanently living on pavement. There are 38 bins (a collection of waste bins, and various recycling bins) permanently on the pavement in Lansdown Walk - left-hand side heading away from Lansdown Road. A further 6 (sometimes more) are permanently on the right-hand pavement. Some of these bins are always overflowing. There is pieces of litter permanently on the pavement. Looks horrendous - but assume the local residents who use the bins accept it / don't care? Why are so many (any) bins allowed to live permanently on the public pavement? Why is there not provision within the buildings (or at least on private land) for all these bins?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lansdown Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Demand/extend loops not working, 15th January
item.description:
At 1am every morning with no other traffic in sight I wait at a red light at the junction of Tewkesbury road and Gloucester Road while the lights go through their sequence, wasting fuel etc Why don’t the loops detect me and change to green??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Townsend Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree falling, 15th January
item.description:
Tree is top heavy with Ivy and leaning over the pavement in Blackwater Way opposite Mutsilver Mews.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Blackwater Way, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BT service duct cover, 15th January
item.description:
The duct cover seems to have been run over by a HGV/LGV and has now sunken. It’s not completely obvious, but when walking over it there’s a drop of around 50mm (2” in old money!)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): G B E C House, 31 Barnett Way, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet
